DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study evaluate effect nutrient dense plant rich ( NDPR ) diet compare standard USDA diet glycemic control , inflammation , cardiovascular risk individual type 2 diabetes overweight/obesity .
DOC.brief_title: Effect Nutrient Dense Plant Rich Diet Glycemic Control People With Type 2 Diabetes Obesity
DOC.criteria: 1 . Men woman age 1875 2 . Type 2 diabetes mellitus diagnose > 6 month prior screen visit accord American Diabetes Association criteria 3 . HBA1c > 7.5 % < 10 % 4 . BMI > 25 kg/m2 ; > 23 kg/m2 Asian subject < 45 kg/m2 5 . Stable weight ( variation < 5 kg within 6 month screen visit ) 6 . Ability give inform consent 7 . Ability follow verbal write instruction English 1 . Active cardiac issue : history myocardial infarction within 3 month screen visit , unstable angina pectoris , Class III Class IV congestive heart failure 2 . Persistent uncontrolled hypertension ( BP > 160/100 mmHg antihypertensive medication ) 3 . Active marijuana intravenous drug use 4 . Recent weight loss ( > 5 kg within 6 month screen visit ) 5 . Inflammatory irritable bowel disease ( Crohn 's Disease , Ulcerative Colitis , IBS ) 6 . Celiac disease 7 . Malignancy treat chemotherapy within past 1 year 8 . Depression psychosis require hospitalization within 1 year , use major antipsychotic tranquilizer drug ( i.e . benzodiazepine ) 9 . Renal insufficiency ( creatinine clearance < 30 ml/min ) 10 . Transaminases > 2x normal range 11 . Pregnancy within 6 month screen visit 12 . Lactation 13 . History surgery treatment obesity ( gastric banding , gastric bypass , gastric staple 14 . History alcohol abuse within past 5 year 15 . Vegetarian/Vegan diet 16 . Dairy Allergy/Intolerance 17 . Anemia , include iron deficient megaloblastic 18 . Vitamin B12 deficiency 19 . Leber 's disease
